abstract: Editorial says defendants offered plea deals need effective counsel to ensure that their decisions are well founded and voluntary, not coerced; cites recent case in Missouri in which man pleaded guilty to driving without a license and was sentenced to three years in prison, only to find out later that his counsel had failed to inform him of an offer in which he could have served only ten days.
snippet: Criminal defendants who are offered plea deals need effective counsel to ensure that their decisions are not coerced.
lead_paragraph: Criminal defendants who are offered plea deals need effective counsel to ensure that their decisions are not coerced.
